I purchased the Samsung Galaxy 10.1 Tablet 4 Black on June 16, 2014 for $447.28 to replace my Miray $149.99 tablet because I wanted to upgrade.

Processor--

The Samsung processor often fails and is extremely slow.  The touch screen does not often activate and it takes a great deal of pressure to activate.  It is extremely frustrating to have to press and press and press with no response.  However, if I lay it on a flat surface it will activate, but I have to wait a minute. Unfortunately, this is not reading posture.

Camera--

The camera function often fails to activate and if there is the slightest movement, it will not take a picture.  However, it will take a photo if you lay it still on a flat surface.

I sell on both Amazon and another site and it took me two weeks to take pictures for a listing.  Today, July 2, 2014 it has taken me since 4:00 p.m. to photograph items I desire to list.  It is now 8:36 p.m. and I have only been able to capture photos for one item.

I have to lay the tablet completely flat and then try to take a photo. I have to performed this action for each photo I take.

This is extremely frustrating and costly.  With my Miray, I was able to photo graph and sell some $700 worth of listings.  The Miray paid for itself in less than two days.

With the Samsung, I have only been able to list a sell two items since I bought the Samsung.

Apps--

The Apps function also fails to activate.  The processor often has a failure message that pops up on the screen.  In order for it to activate, you will have to reset.

Recommendation--

I do not recommend this product because it does not function as need for even basil level tasks.  My $149.99 Miray functions better, faster, and is more reliable than this overpriced inadequate tablet.  I bought it for the looks and that's about all it's is adequate for at this point.

Let's face it, everyone wants to know how it compares to the God of tablets: the iPad. It's every bit as good. Now that it's common for people to jail break their iPads to be more like Droid devices, it's pretty obvious which is more user friendly.

The only downside of going with Droid rather than Apple is the app availability, but that's hardly the fault of a device. Strictly speaking, this thing is awesome. I didn't buy it over the iPad to save a couple hundred bucks, I bought it because it's more versatile and practical.

Pros : Sleek, lightweight, has the same "home" button used on Samsung's smart phone line, with similar menus.
Just fast enough to play a properly formatted movie or some music.
Decent color reproduction.

Cons : Abysmally poor sound quality and volume ( You'll need headphones or a bluetooth speaker ).
Battery life and screen resolution not up to par with competitors for the same price.
Charge time is ridiculously long.
In order to use a card reader or external usb device, you must buy an expensive, proprietary dongle from Samsung. While using said dongle with a card reader, battery percentage as reported on screen never goes down, no warning of low battery, and it will drain until tablet shuts off. To add insult to injury, the dongle plugs in the charging port on the bottom of the tablet, making it impossible to set the tablet upright to watch movies. Whoever designed that port should be fired.

I was getting ready to buy the Tab 3 when I noticed on the Samsung website that the Tab 4 was available for pre-order and would be released in a week, with almost double the processing power, and only $20 more. I'm one of those oddballs who can't fall asleep unless the TV is on, but my Apt does not have A/C, so the heat given off by the TV gets pretty bad. This works quite well with the Samsung Galaxy Multimedia Desktop Charging Dock for Samsung Galaxy Phones (although make sure that you buy it directly from Amazon, as some of the affiliated sellers are sending clone/counterfeit units that break almost instantly) going into docking mode, charging, and using the external speakers. I take my Tab with me to read comic books on the bus on my commute, and then when I get home, I dock it and load up Netflix, Hulu+, or Stitcher on my desk, turn it to face the bed when I'm ready to doze off, and never have to power on the space heater that disguises itself as a TV. One odd note: I also have the Samsung Galaxy Smart Dock Multimedia Hub for Galaxy Note II/ Galaxy S 4/ Galaxy S 4 Active/ Galaxy Mega which works beautifully for my Note 2, but works ONLY as a stand and charger with the Tab 4. It does not go into docking mode, or recognize the USB/HDMI ports and external speakers.

The first one I received was defective. However with Amazons amazing return plan this was a minor problem.

If it weren't for the following two things I'd give it a 4 or a 5 however

1) If you connect it to a computer this device is not seen as a simple storage device. It thinks it's a music player using something called MTP. This is truly annoying since I wanted to simply move files to the device using the standard drag and drop methodology. There are workarounds but they are annoying

2) It will NOT charge off of a computers USB port. I left it plugged in for an hour and it didn't gain even a percentage point. This truly sucks big time. You can charge it from the wall socket but not from your computer.
The camera is not that good and you might as well search between the new releases. But I am using it a lot and what I most love about it is that it doesn't look really fragile. Which is great!

Amazons quality control or shipping control needs to be checked, or maybe its the carriers? I'm not sure.

I personally know my local USPS does not handle packages like some Fedex and UPS workers we've all seen in Youtube viral videos destroying packages. I can't speak for the rest of the shipping team in other parts of the city and country. The box it arrived in wasn't damaged at all though, it had a minor crease in it, can't even call it a dent. The Tablet however arrived with a crack in the upper left hand corner of the screen, which at first seemed very minor and my mother still loved the gift and decided she would keep it anyway due to her being old and not caring for superficial things like us modern day kids do. However, almost a week later she started to complain to me that she couldn't figure out how to use some of the features correctly. I inspected the product further and after some testing I noticed about a quarter of the screen where the crack was located was not functioning properly. While there were no cracks in the screen itself, only the glass protecting the screen, the finger sensor was not reading her finger so when she tried to click on things to swipe it didn't work in that specific region leading to almost all if not all the apps not working properly.

Talking to Amazon they offered a replacement or refund, I would rather have a replacement considering my moms loves the idea of being able to watch T.v and E-mail from anywhere. I opted for that and now I'll be receiving a replacement in a few days.

Overall happy, just wish it didn't come as it did.

The product however 5/5 Stars, its a tablet on steroids, No need for overpriced Ipads.
